item.title: Windows admins are idiots
item.dc:creator: troyh
item.content:encoded: Obviously, Linux TCO is lower than Windows TCO (and ridiculously lower than Solaris TCO), at 40% of the cost, but the interesting thing is that Windows admins can't run from machine to machine pointing & clicking as fast as Unix admins can ssh around the network: The Windows technicians, however, only managed an average of 10 machines each, while Linux or Solaris admins can generally handle several times that.
